MESSAGES: ROLE: system

You are a helpful assistant who can understand and analyze tutorial videos.
ROLE: user

You are performing temporal segmentation of a tutorial video for Making Muffins based on Focus objects (i.e., Label content according to whether it refers to components mixed into the batter (interior), components applied on top or as finishing (exterior), or descriptions about the whole muffin product.).

### INPUTS
- Canonical segment labels (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[S1] ..."):
[S1] Filling
Definition: Ingredients or instructions intended to be mixed into the batter or incorporated into the interior of the muffin (e.g., ingredients stirred or folded into batter).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries
	- Context 1: once you have your batter finished, you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries, or frozen even, you can use those too.
	- Content 2: fold in 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips
	- Context 2: Then just for fun I'm going to add in 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips and fold those in.
```
[S2] Topping
Definition: Components applied on top of the muffin or used as a finishing touch (e.g., streusel, butter, drizzles, or anything placed on/added after baking).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top
	- Context 1: One fun topping you can experiment with is sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top of your muffins.
	- Content 2: topped with simple and delicious brown sugar streusel
	- Context 2: They're loaded with a ton of blueberries and they're topped with simple and delicious brown sugar streusel.
```
[S3] Product
Definition: Descriptions or claims about the overall muffin product, including appearance, texture, or general character of the finished muffins.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: my Master Muffin Recipe
	- Context 1: Instead of giving you dozens of recipes for different flavors of muffins, today I'm sharing my Master Muffin Recipe, which you can use to make almost any flavor, and it's super easy.
	- Content 2: fluffy and moist blueberry muffins
	- Context 2: Hey guys, I'm Dina from simplyhomecooked.com and today I'll be showing you how to make these fluffy and moist blueberry muffins.
```
[S4] Action
Definition: Procedural steps or actions (preparation, mixing, chilling, baking instructions) that describe how to perform tasks but do not specifically name interior or exterior components.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit
	- Context 1: Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
	- Content 2: divide the batter up amongst our 12 muffin cups
	- Context 2: We're going to divide the batter up amongst our 12 muffin cups, and you should fill each one about 2 thirds of the way full.
```
- Pieces of information (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[p12] ..."):
[1] Going to the grocery store has become a difficult quest to find the perfect bananas.
[2] The Clothier household prefers bananas that are still a bit green.
[3] Greener bananas are firmer.
[4] Greener bananas have a better flavor.
[5] Decide how many bananas to buy based on how many will be eaten in the next few days.
[6] Consider whether one banana per day per person is appropriate when deciding how many to buy.
[7] Consider whether bananas will be used in cereal or other dishes when deciding how many to buy.
[8] The ripeness (how green the bananas are) is the most important factor in deciding whether to buy them.
[9] Sometimes buy some bananas that will be perfect in a couple of days and some that are perfect right now.
[10] Sometimes one or two bananas go uneaten or ripen faster than expected.
[11] Banana bread (and similar banana baked goods) was likely created to use bananas that are blackening before they go to waste.
[12] The muffins have a crumbly coating on top.
[13] The crumbly topping adds texture and flavor to the muffins.
[14] The added texture and flavor from the crumble is worth the extra calories.
[15] The presenter does not make these muffins often.
[16] The presenter does not worry much about how unhealthy the muffins might be.
[17] If concerned about calories, using the gym is an option.
[18] Step 1 is the list of ingredients.
[19] Ingredients for the bread are listed separately from the topping and optional items.
[20] Use 3 to 4 bananas, mashed, for the bread.
[21] Use 2 cups of all-purpose flour for the bread.
[22] Use 3/4 cup white sugar for the bread.
[23] Use 1/4 cup brown sugar for the bread.
[24] Use 1 stick of butter, softened, for the bread.
[25] Use 2 eggs, slightly beaten, for the bread.
[26] Use 1 teaspoon of vanilla for the bread.
[27] Use 1 teaspoon of baking soda for the bread.
[28] Use 1/2 teaspoon of salt for the bread.
[29] For the topping use 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
[30] For the topping use 1/3 cup brown sugar.
[31] For the topping use 1 tablespoon of cinnamon.
[32] Optional: use 1 cup of chopped walnuts.
[33] Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit once all ingredients are gathered.
[34] Step 2 is to prepare the bananas.
[35] Peel the bananas and place them in a large bowl.
[36] Bananas with a few spots are acceptable for this recipe.
[37] Cut away any very black parts of bananas if those parts are unappealing.
[38] Peel off any clingy banana strings.
[39] Using a sturdy utensil, thoroughly smash the bananas until mostly liquified.
[40] Be careful when smashing bananas because a utensil could break from excessive force.
[41] Smashing bananas can serve as a stress reliever or an arm workout.
[42] Stop smashing when the bananas are mostly liquified but still have a few bits for texture.
[43] Step 3 is a sweet start where butter and sugars are combined.
[44] Ensure the butter is softened but not melted before combining with sugar.
[45] Combine the softened butter with 3/4 cup white sugar and 1/4 cup brown sugar.
[46] Use a fork or a strong whisk to blend the butter and sugars.
[47] Mix the butter and sugars until the mixture is well blended and creamy.
[48] Step 4 is to mix the wet ingredients with the mashed bananas.
[49] Beat the eggs and add them to the vanilla and the butter/sugar mixture.
[50] Combine the beaten eggs, vanilla, and butter/sugar mixture into the mashed bananas.
[51] If adding walnuts, add them when combining the wet ingredients into the bananas.
[52] Step 5 is to add dry ingredients and finish the batter.
[53] Add the flour, baking soda, and salt to the banana/egg mixture.
[54] Mix the flour, baking soda, and salt into the batter until the dry ingredients are totally incorporated.
[55] Pour the finished batter into the chosen cooking pan.
[56] This recipe can be made as muffins, a loaf, or a cake.
[57] Step 6 is to prepare the topping.
[58] Blend the olive oil, brown sugar, and cinnamon until the mixture becomes very crumbly.
[59] Sprinkle the crumbly topping over the batter.
[60] It is acceptable to make extra topping and apply it thickly.
[61] Typically, butter is used to make a streusel topping.
[62] The recipe uses oil for the topping because there is already a stick of butter in the batter and the presenter is trying to reduce butter intake.
[63] If preferred, replace the oil with 1 to 2 tablespoons of butter for the topping.
[64] Step 7 is to bake the muffins or chosen pan of batter.
[65] Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit if not already preheated.
[66] Bake the batter for a time appropriate to the chosen pan.
[67] Bake muffins for 18 to 20 minutes.
[68] Test muffins with a clean knife or toothpick to ensure they are done.
[69] Let the baked goods cool on a rack for 15 minutes or until they can be safely touched.
[70] After cooling for 15 minutes, proceed with serving or storing the muffins as desired.
[71] The presenter implies the remaining steps (serving and eating) are straightforward.

### INPUTS
- Canonical segment labels (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[S1] ..."):
[S1] Filling
Definition: Ingredients or instructions intended to be mixed into the batter or incorporated into the interior of the muffin (e.g., ingredients stirred or folded into batter).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries
	- Context 1: once you have your batter finished, you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries, or frozen even, you can use those too.
	- Content 2: fold in 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips
	- Context 2: Then just for fun I'm going to add in 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips and fold those in.
```
[S2] Topping
Definition: Components applied on top of the muffin or used as a finishing touch (e.g., streusel, butter, drizzles, or anything placed on/added after baking).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top
	- Context 1: One fun topping you can experiment with is sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top of your muffins.
	- Content 2: topped with simple and delicious brown sugar streusel
	- Context 2: They're loaded with a ton of blueberries and they're topped with simple and delicious brown sugar streusel.
```
[S3] Product
Definition: Descriptions or claims about the overall muffin product, including appearance, texture, or general character of the finished muffins.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: my Master Muffin Recipe
	- Context 1: Instead of giving you dozens of recipes for different flavors of muffins, today I'm sharing my Master Muffin Recipe, which you can use to make almost any flavor, and it's super easy.
	- Content 2: fluffy and moist blueberry muffins
	- Context 2: Hey guys, I'm Dina from simplyhomecooked.com and today I'll be showing you how to make these fluffy and moist blueberry muffins.
```
[S4] Action
Definition: Procedural steps or actions (preparation, mixing, chilling, baking instructions) that describe how to perform tasks but do not specifically name interior or exterior components.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit
	- Context 1: Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
	- Content 2: divide the batter up amongst our 12 muffin cups
	- Context 2: We're going to divide the batter up amongst our 12 muffin cups, and you should fill each one about 2 thirds of the way full.

- Pieces of information (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[p12] ..."):
[1] This is a one-bowl oatmeal protein muffin recipe.
[2] The recipe is low in sugar.
[3] The recipe is flexible with substitutions.
[4] The recipe includes three simple sources of protein: nut butter, chia seeds, and flaxseed.
[5] These muffins are seriously delicious.
[6] Image shows oatmeal protein muffins with chocolate chips and banana chips.
[7] List of things you'll need for the recipe follows.
[8] Use 3 very ripe bananas or 1 cup of applesauce.
[9] Use 1 cup of milk, which can be dairy, coconut, or almond.
[10] Use 1/2 cup peanut butter or any nut butter.
[11] Use 2 eggs.
[12] Use 1/4 cup maple syrup or honey.
[13] Use 1 teaspoon vanilla.
[14] Use 1 tablespoon baking powder.
[15] Use 1/4 cup ground flaxseed.
[16] Use 1 tablespoon chia seeds.
[17] Use 3 cups whole oats.
[18] Optional toppings include chocolate chips and dried banana chips.
[19] Tip: The peanut butter-banana base can be adapted to suit many different tastes.
[20] Applesauce works in place of bananas.
[21] Any nut butter can be used instead of peanut butter.
[22] Image shows ingredients for oatmeal protein muffins.
[23] Get started by preheating the oven to 375 degrees F.
[24] Grease the muffin pan.
[25] Use coconut oil, spray, or butter to grease the pan.
[26] Mash the bananas in a large mixing bowl.
[27] Image caption: The browner the bananas, the better for baking because they have more flavor.
[28] A potato masher works best for very ripe bananas.
[29] A fork can be used to mash very ripe bananas if a potato masher is not available.
[30] Add the remaining ingredients to the mashed bananas.
[31] Combine all ingredients and stir until thoroughly mixed.
[32] Image caption: Use regular milk, almond milk, or coconut milk.
[33] Image caption: There is no need to beat the eggs ahead of time; just crack and mix them.
[34] Image caption: Maple syrup was used here but honey is also delicious.
[35] Make the recipe gluten-free by using specially marked containers of whole oats.
[36] There is no worry of over-mixing because this recipe does not use flour.
[37] Prepare to bake by filling muffin cups to the top.
[38] Use a 3-ounce ice cream scoop to evenly distribute muffin batter into pans.
[39] Add optional toppings such as chocolate chips or banana chips at the time of filling the cups.
[40] Tip: Place a couple of chocolate or banana chips in the bottom of each cup before ladling in the batter.
[41] Tip: Try using coconut oil spray to grease the pan.
[42] Bake the muffins at 375 degrees F for 25 minutes.
[43] After baking, cool the muffins on a rack.
[44] Image shows oatmeal protein muffins with banana chips on top.
[45] Store baked muffins refrigerated in an airtight container for 3 to 5 days.
[46] Freeze muffins in a single layer inside a zip-top freezer bag for longer storage.
[47] Image caption: Mix and match your toppings, or add more.

ROLE: user

You are performing temporal segmentation of a tutorial video for Making Muffins based on Focus objects (i.e., Label content according to whether it refers to components mixed into the batter (interior), components applied on top or as finishing (exterior), or descriptions about the whole muffin product.).

### INPUTS
- Canonical segment labels (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[S1] ..."):
[S1] Filling
Definition: Ingredients or instructions intended to be mixed into the batter or incorporated into the interior of the muffin (e.g., ingredients stirred or folded into batter).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries
	- Context 1: once you have your batter finished, you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries, or frozen even, you can use those too.
	- Content 2: fold in 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips
	- Context 2: Then just for fun I'm going to add in 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips and fold those in.
```
[S2] Topping
Definition: Components applied on top of the muffin or used as a finishing touch (e.g., streusel, butter, drizzles, or anything placed on/added after baking).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top
	- Context 1: One fun topping you can experiment with is sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top of your muffins.
	- Content 2: topped with simple and delicious brown sugar streusel
	- Context 2: They're loaded with a ton of blueberries and they're topped with simple and delicious brown sugar streusel.
```
[S3] Product
Definition: Descriptions or claims about the overall muffin product, including appearance, texture, or general character of the finished muffins.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: my Master Muffin Recipe
	- Context 1: Instead of giving you dozens of recipes for different flavors of muffins, today I'm sharing my Master Muffin Recipe, which you can use to make almost any flavor, and it's super easy.
	- Content 2: fluffy and moist blueberry muffins
	- Context 2: Hey guys, I'm Dina from simplyhomecooked.com and today I'll be showing you how to make these fluffy and moist blueberry muffins.
```
[S4] Action
Definition: Procedural steps or actions (preparation, mixing, chilling, baking instructions) that describe how to perform tasks but do not specifically name interior or exterior components.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit
	- Context 1: Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
	- Content 2: divide the batter up amongst our 12 muffin cups
	- Context 2: We're going to divide the batter up amongst our 12 muffin cups, and you should fill each one about 2 thirds of the way full.
```
- Pieces of information (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[p12] ..."):
[1] Homemade muffins are a special addition to breakfast or brunch.
[2] Enjoy muffins with friends and family.
[3] Make muffins as a grab-and-go breakfast for busy work weeks.
[4] Morning Glory muffins are warmly spiced with cinnamon.
[5] Morning Glory muffins are made with grated carrot, grated apple, raisins, chopped walnuts, shredded coconut, and sometimes pineapple.
[6] While the ingredient list for Morning Glory muffins is long, the baking process is simple.
[7] This recipe makes 12 muffins.
[8] Things you'll need are listed next.
[9] 1-1/4 cups all-purpose flour is required.
[10] 1 cup shredded coconut is required.
[11] 3/4 cup light brown sugar, tightly packed, is required.
[12] 1-1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon is required.
[13] 1/2 teaspoon sea salt is required.
[14] 1 teaspoon baking powder is required.
[15] 1 cup grated carrot, about 1 large carrot peeled and grated, is required.
[16] 1 cup grated apple, about half a large apple such as Honeycrisp, is required.
[17] 1/2 cup raisins is required.
[18] 1/2 cup raw walnuts, chopped, is required.
[19] 2 large eggs are required.
[20] 1/4 cup olive oil or canola oil is required.
[21] 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract is required.
[22] A box grater is required.
[23] Two mixing bowls are required.
[24] A spoon or fork for mixing is required.
[25] Twelve disposable baking cups are required.
[26] A 12-hole muffin tray is required.
[27] Tip header introduces time-saving and substitution suggestions.
[28] To save time, use a food processor to shred the carrot and apple.
[29] Replace all-purpose flour with gluten-free all-purpose flour to make the muffins gluten-free.
[30] Replace brown sugar with coconut sugar to make naturally sweetened, refined sugar-free muffins.
[31] You can choose to use sweetened or unsweetened shredded coconut.
[32] Instructions for making the muffins follow.
[33] Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
[34] Grate 1 cup-worth of carrot.
[35] Grate 1 cup-worth of apple.
[36] Add the flour to a mixing bowl.
[37] Add the ground cinnamon to the mixing bowl.
[38] Add the brown sugar to the mixing bowl.
[39] Add the baking powder to the mixing bowl.
[40] Add the salt to the mixing bowl.
[41] Stir the flour, cinnamon, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt together in the mixing bowl.
[42] Add the grated carrot to the flour mixture.
[43] Add the grated apple to the flour mixture.
[44] Add the raisins to the flour mixture.
[45] Add the chopped walnuts to the flour mixture.
[46] Stir the grated carrot, grated apple, raisins, and chopped walnuts into the flour mixture to combine.
[47] In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, oil, and vanilla extract.
[48] Add the egg, oil, and vanilla mixture to the bowl with the flour mixture.
[49] Stir the combined wet and dry mixtures well until a thick batter forms.
[50] Line a 12-hole muffin pan with baking cups.
[51] Scoop batter into the lined muffin pan using an ice cream scoop or small measuring cup.
[52] Fill each muffin hole two-thirds of the way up with batter.
[53] Bake the muffins on the center rack of the preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes.
[54] Bake until muffins test clean when poked with a toothpick.
[55] Allow the muffins to cool for 10 minutes before serving.
[56] Enjoy the muffins.

[9] Whisk the ingredients well until they are well combined.
[10] Sift flour into the bowl along with baking powder.
[11] Add a pinch of salt while sifting the flour.
[12] Adding flour with baking powder and salt makes muffins soft and fluffy.
[13] Whisk wet and dry ingredients for a short minute until lumps are gone.
[14] Do not overmix the batter.
[15] Rinse the blueberries.
[16] Shake the water off the blueberries.
[17] Add the blueberries to a bowl after rinsing and shaking off the water.
[18] Toss the blueberries with cornstarch.
[19] Add the cornstarch-coated blueberries to the batter.
[20] Stir the blueberries in the mixture gently.
[21] Fold the blueberries into the mixture gently.
[22] Transfer the batter to the muffin liners.
[23] This recipe yields about 12 muffins.
[24] Fill the muffin liners almost to the top.
[25] Optionally sprinkle sugar on top of the muffins.
[26] Do not sprinkle sugar because the muffins are intended for breakfast.
[27] Bake the muffins in a preheated oven for 22 and a half minutes.
[28] Bake the muffins until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out dry.
[29] Let the muffins cool down for about 30 minutes.

[S2] Topping
Definition: Components applied on top of the muffin or used as a finishing touch (e.g., streusel, butter, drizzles, or anything placed on/added after baking).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top

```
[S3] Product
Definition: Descriptions or claims about the overall muffin product, including appearance, texture, or general character of the finished muffins.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: my Master Muffin Recipe
	- Context 1: Instead of giving you dozens of recipes for different flavors of muffins, today I'm sharing my Master Muffin Recipe, which you can use to make almost any flavor, and it's super easy.

Definition: Procedural steps or actions (preparation, mixing, chilling, baking instructions) that describe how to perform tasks but do not specifically name interior or exterior components.

### INPUTS
- Canonical segment labels (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[S1] ..."):
[S1] Filling
Definition: Ingredients or instructions intended to be mixed into the batter or incorporated into the interior of the muffin (e.g., ingredients stirred or folded into batter).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries
	- Context 1: once you have your batter finished, you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries, or frozen even, you can use those too.
	- Content 2: fold in 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips
	- Context 2: Then just for fun I'm going to add in 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips and fold those in.
```
[S2] Topping
Definition: Components applied on top of the muffin or used as a finishing touch (e.g., streusel, butter, drizzles, or anything placed on/added after baking).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top
	- Context 1: One fun topping you can experiment with is sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top of your muffins.
	- Content 2: topped with simple and delicious brown sugar streusel
	- Context 2: They're loaded with a ton of blueberries and they're topped with simple and delicious brown sugar streusel.
```
[S3] Product
Definition: Descriptions or claims about the overall muffin product, including appearance, texture, or general character of the finished muffins.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: my Master Muffin Recipe
	- Context 1: Instead of giving you dozens of recipes for different flavors of muffins, today I'm sharing my Master Muffin Recipe, which you can use to make almost any flavor, and it's super easy.
	- Content 2: fluffy and moist blueberry muffins
	- Context 2: Hey guys, I'm Dina from simplyhomecooked.com and today I'll be showing you how to make these fluffy and moist blueberry muffins.
```
[S4] Action
Definition: Procedural steps or actions (preparation, mixing, chilling, baking instructions) that describe how to perform tasks but do not specifically name interior or exterior components.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit
	- Context 1: Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
	- Content 2: divide the batter up amongst our 12 muffin cups
	- Context 2: We're going to divide the batter up amongst our 12 muffin cups, and you should fill each one about 2 thirds of the way full.
```
- Pieces of information (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[p12] ..."):
[1] Hey guys, I'm Dina from simplyhomecooked.com.
[2] Today I'll be showing you how to make fluffy and moist blueberry muffins.
[3] The muffins are loaded with a ton of blueberries.
[4] The muffins are topped with a simple and delicious brown sugar streusel.
[5] Start by combining all dry ingredients.
[6] In a large bowl, combine two cups of all-purpose flour.
[7] In a large bowl, add one teaspoon of baking powder.
[8] In a large bowl, add half a teaspoon of baking soda.
[9] In a large bowl, add a quarter teaspoon of salt.
[10] Whisk the dry ingredients together.
[11] Reserve one tablespoon of the flour mixture.
[12] Mix the reserved tablespoon of the flour mixture with one and a half cups of fresh blueberries.
[13] The reason for adding a small amount of flour to the blueberries is related to when the blueberries are added to the batter.
[14] Coating blueberries in flour prevents the blueberries from sinking as fast during baking.
[15] Add three eggs into a large bowl.
[16] Whisk the three eggs on high speed using an electric mixer.
[17] Whisk the eggs for about three minutes until the eggs become fluffy and pale.
[18] Continue beating the eggs as you slowly add one cup of granulated sugar.
[19] Keep beating the eggs for about three more minutes after adding the sugar.
[20] Well-beaten eggs are the key to really fluffy muffins.
[21] Add one teaspoon of vanilla extract.
[22] Add one tablespoon of fresh lemon juice.
[23] Continue beating the egg mixture as you slowly add three quarters of a cup of heavy cream.
[24] Begin adding the dry ingredients to the wet mixture rather than adding all at once.
[25] Do not add all of the dry ingredients to the batter at once.
[26] Get a sifter.
[27] Add about a third of the flour mixture at a time to the batter.
[28] Mix between each addition of the flour mixture.
[29] Once all of the dry ingredients are well combined into the muffin batter, the batter is ready for the next step.
[30] Continue beating the batter with an electric mixer while preparing to add butter.
[31] Slowly and gradually add four tablespoons of melted unsalted butter to the batter.
[32] The last step before portioning is adding the blueberries.
[33] Fold the blueberries into the batter with a spatula.
[34] Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners.
[35] Begin scooping the batter into the lined muffin tin using a large cookie scoop.
[36] Top each muffin with a few extra blueberries if desired.
[37] Topping muffins with extra blueberries is optional.
[38] Before baking, make a simple streusel topping.
[39] In a small bowl, combine one tablespoon of unsalted cold cubed butter, two tablespoons of all-purpose flour, a pinch of salt, one teaspoon of cinnamon, and three tablespoons of brown sugar.
[40] Mash the streusel ingredients together using a fork until the ingredients are well combined.
[41] Mash the streusel ingredients until they have a crumbly texture.
[42] Top the blueberry muffins with the streusel topping.
[43] Bake the topped muffins in the oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for about 35 minutes.
[44] I hope you enjoyed watching this video; please share, like, and subscribe to the channel.
[45] See you next time!

[2] Instead of giving dozens of recipes for different flavors of muffins, present a single Master Muffin Recipe.
[3] Use the Master Muffin Recipe to make almost any flavor of muffin.
[4] The Master Muffin Recipe is super easy.
[5] Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
[6] Line a 12-cup muffin tin with paper baking cups.
[7] Spritz nonstick cooking spray on paper baking cups to prevent muffins from sticking.
[8] Prepare the batter.
[9] Demonstrate a basic muffin batter first.
[10] Show 5 different variations that build upon the base recipe.
[11] Start the batter with 1 cup of softened salted butter.
[12] Start the batter with 1 cup of granulated sugar.
[13] Use a hand mixer to cream together butter and sugar.
[14] At first the butter and sugar mixture will be lumpy.
[15] Keep mixing the butter and sugar for about 2 minutes.
[16] After 2 minutes the sugar and butter will be well combined.
[17] After 2 minutes the mixture will have a smooth, creamy paste-like consistency.
[18] Add in 2 large eggs.
[19] Mix the eggs into the butter and sugar briefly until just combined, about 30 seconds.
[20] Add 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract.
[21] You can use other flavors of extract such as almond, orange, or lemon.
[22] Use 1 teaspoon for lemon and other citrus extracts and combine that with 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract.
[23] Add 2 teaspoons of baking powder.
[24] Add 1 teaspoon of salt.
[25] Add any spices like cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice at this point.
[26] Give the mixture a quick mix for about 10 seconds to combine after adding baking powder, salt, and any spices.
[27] Stop using the hand mixer and grab a rubber spatula at this point.
[28] Add one half of the all-purpose flour now.
[29] Use a total of 2 cups of all-purpose flour in the recipe.
[30] Add 1 cup of all-purpose flour at this stage.
[31] Use the rubber spatula to stir the flour in.
[32] Once white specks of flour start to disappear, pour in 1/2 cup of milk or buttermilk.
[33] Buttermilk gives a poofier muffin.
[34] Stir the milk or buttermilk into the batter until well combined.
[35] Add the remaining 1 cup of all-purpose flour.
[36] Stir the batter together, scraping the sides and bottom of the bowl to ensure everything gets mixed in.
[37] Add dried fruit, chocolate chips, or berries into the batter after it is mixed if desired.
[38] The batter should be thick but also spreadable.
[39] Divide the batter among the 12 muffin cups.
[40] Fill each muffin cup about two-thirds of the way full.
[41] Try to divide the batter as evenly as possible because the recipe makes 12 muffins.
[42] Let muffin batter rest for about 15 minutes before baking if desired.
[43] If making a larger batch, it is okay to let the batter rest between baking different batches.
[44] Bake muffins in the 425 degree oven for 7 minutes.
[45] After 7 minutes, reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees without opening the oven door.
[46] Continue baking for 12–15 minutes and watch muffins carefully because cooking time varies by oven.
[47] Start variations with a lemon blueberry muffin.
[48] A lemon blueberry muffin demonstrates using another flavor of extract and adding fresh fruit.
[49] After creaming sugar and butter and adding eggs, add 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract and 1 teaspoon of lemon extract before baking powder and salt for the lemon blueberry variation.
[50] Continue with the rest of the master muffin recipe by adding flour and buttermilk for the lemon blueberry variation.
[51] After finishing the batter for lemon blueberry muffins, add 1 cup of fresh blueberries.
[52] You can use frozen blueberries instead of fresh blueberries.
[53] Optionally add the zest of 1 lemon, about 1 tablespoon of lemon zest.
[54] Fold lemon zest and blueberries into the batter.
[55] Divide the lemon blueberry batter evenly among the 12 muffin cups.
[56] Sprinkle about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top of muffins as a topping option.
[57] Sprinkling granulated sugar on top gives muffins a crunchy sweet top.
[58] Bake lemon blueberry muffins using the same baking procedure as the base recipe.
[59] Make a chocolate muffin version next.
[60] For a chocolate version, use butter and sugar as before and add 1/2 cup of unsweetened cocoa powder.
[61] Cream unsweetened cocoa powder in with the butter and sugar.
[62] Proceed with the master muffin recipe by adding eggs, baking powder, salt, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, and milk or buttermilk for the chocolate variation.
[63] Adding cocoa powder does not significantly change the texture of the final batter.
[64] Add 1 cup of semisweet chocolate chips and fold them into the chocolate batter.
[65] When mixing add-ins, keep the total amount of additions (chocolate chips, nuts, dried fruit) to 1 cup total.
[66] Demonstrate a muffin hack using instant pudding to switch up flavors quickly.
[67] For the pudding variation, use only 3/4 cup of granulated sugar.
[68] Replace the missing 1/4 cup of sugar with a 3.4 ounce package of instant pudding mix.
[69] Use pistachio instant pudding mix as one flavor option.
[70] Cream the pudding mix and adjusted sugar together with the butter as directed and proceed with the master muffin recipe.
[71] You can fold in chopped pistachios into the pudding-flavored batter if desired.
[72] Instant pudding variation is fun because many flavors of instant pudding make it easy to mix and match flavors quickly without buying many extracts.
[73] Show how easy it is to mix and match add-ins to add flavor without much hassle.
[74] Demonstrate a cranberry white chocolate chip muffin with a little bit of orange zest.
[75] Use the master recipe with no alterations as the base for the cranberry white chocolate chip variation.
[76] Add 1/2 cup of dried cranberries for the cranberry white chocolate chip variation.
[77] Add 1/2 cup of white chocolate chips so the total add-ins equal 1 cup.
[78] If no orange extract is available, add 1/2 tablespoon of orange zest total to add a hint of orange flavor.
[79] Fold in add-ins until ingredients are evenly distributed.
[80] You can use chocolate chips, raisins, or nuts as add-in options because possibilities are endless.
[81] Show how to add spices to the muffin base.
[82] Demonstrate a cinnamon muffin with cinnamon chips folded in topped with a brown sugar streusel.
[83] Cream butter and sugar, add eggs, baking powder, salt, and vanilla extract before adding cinnamon for the cinnamon variation.
[84] Add 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon.
[85] You can use between 1/2 teaspoon and 1 full teaspoon of ground cinnamon.
[86] Adjust the amount of cinnamon depending on how pronounced you want the cinnamon flavor.
[87] Finish the cinnamon muffin batter with the rest of the master muffin recipe by adding flour and buttermilk.
[88] Fold in 1 cup of cinnamon chips.
[89] Cinnamon chips can be harder to find when it's not the holidays.
[90] Divide the batter into prepared muffin cups before making the streusel topping.
[91] A streusel is easy to make and is a decadent addition to many muffin flavors.
[92] Start streusel with 1/4 cup of cold cubed butter.
[93] Add 1/2 cup of brown sugar to the streusel.
[94] Add 1/2 cup of all-purpose flour to the streusel.
[95] Add 1/4 teaspoon of ground cinnamon to the streusel.
[96] Use a pastry cutter or two knives to cut the streusel ingredients together.
[97] Cut streusel together until it resembles a coarse meal or sand.
[98] Sprinkle the streusel generously on top of muffin batter.
[99] The streusel looks like little piles of sand on top of each muffin.
[100] The baking time for muffins with streusel and other variations is the same as the base recipe.
[101] You can make almost any muffin flavor using one master recipe.

[103] Find the full written recipe and other flavor ideas in the video description.

MESSAGES: ROLE: system

You are a helpful assistant who can understand and analyze tutorial videos.
ROLE: user

You are performing temporal segmentation of a tutorial video for Making Muffins based on Property types (i.e., Label declarative statements that assert a property of an ingredient by which kind of attribute they claim: texture, flavor, or ripeness/visual state.).

### INPUTS
- Canonical segment labels (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[S1] ..."):
[S1] Texture
Definition: Claims about an ingredient's or finished item's physical feel, mouthfeel, firmness/softness, or form that affects texture.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: softened salted butter
	- Context 1: [42 - 48] The batter starts with 1 cup of softened salted butter, and 1 cup of granulated sugar.
	- Content 2: thick but also spreadable
	- Context 2: [150 - 153] Your batter should be thick but also spreadable.
```
[S2] Flavor
Definition: Claims about taste, seasoning, or flavor qualities of an ingredient or the final product.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
	- Context 1: [210 - 221] I've already creamed together the sugar and butter and added in the eggs, so now I'm going to add in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1 teaspoon of lemon extract...
	- Content 2: a nice little crunchy sweet top
	- Context 2: [248 - 255] One fun topping you can experiment with is sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top of your muffins. [255 - 257] This gives it a nice little crunchy sweet top.
```
[S3] Ripeness
Definition: Statements about color, visual state, or degree of maturation or ingredient state (e.g., fresh, frozen, green, ripe, overripe).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: fresh blueberries
	- Context 1: [221 - 232] Continue on with the rest of the recipe, adding in the flour and buttermilk, once you have your batter finished, you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries, or frozen even, you can use those too.
	- Content 2: frozen even
	- Context 2: [221 - 232] Continue on with the rest of the recipe, adding in the flour and buttermilk, once you have your batter finished, you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries, or frozen even, you can use those too.
```
[S4] Temperature
Definition: Statements about the temperature or thermal state of an ingredient or finished item (e.g., room temperature, chilled, warm, oven temperature, storage temperature).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit
	- Context 1: [14 - 18] Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
	- Content 2: cold cubed butter
	- Context 2: [462 - 465] It starts with 1/4 cup of cold cubed butter.
```
- Pieces of information (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[p12] ..."):
[1] The video presents a combination of spicy pumpkin and cheesecake in bite-sized muffins.
[2] The muffin is described as the treat you've been waiting for.
[3] These muffins are soft with a saucy swirl of cheesecake.
[4] These muffins make a suitable treat to bring to holiday gatherings.
[5] The recipe works for jumbo muffins or bite-sized minis.
[6] The muffins are likely to be an instant hit.
[7] Step 1: Ingredients.
[8] TOOLS heading is listed.
[9] Use a mini muffin tin.
[10] Use a mixer.
[11] Use a digital scale.
[12] The presenter states a preference for a particular digital scale.
[13] MUFFINS heading is listed.
[14] Use 1 15-ounce can of pumpkin.
[15] Use 1/4 cup vegetable oil.
[16] Use 2 large eggs.
[17] Use 1 cup (200 g) sugar.
[18] Use 1 teaspoon vanilla.
[19] Use 1 1/2 cups (188 g) all-purpose flour.
[20] Use 1 teaspoon baking powder.
[21] Use 1/2 teaspoon baking soda.
[22] Use 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon.
[23] Use 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger.
[24] Use 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg.
[25] Use 1/8 teaspoon ground cloves.
[26] Use 1/2 teaspoon salt.
[27] Use 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper.
[28] FILLING heading is listed.
[29] Use 8 ounces (200 g) cream cheese at room temperature for the filling.
[30] Use 1 large egg yolk for the filling.
[31] Use 5 tablespoons (75 g) sugar for the filling.
[32] Use 1/8 teaspoon vanilla extract for the filling.
[33] Chopped nuts such as walnuts or pecans are optional for topping.
[34] Step 2: Muffins.
[35] Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
[36] Mix canned pumpkin, vegetable oil, and sugar together by hand or with a mixer on low.
[37] Add eggs to the pumpkin mixture one at a time.
[38] Combine each egg thoroughly after adding it.
[39] Add vanilla to the mixture.
[40] Whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and spices.
[41] Slowly add the flour mixture to the liquid pumpkin mixture.
[42] Combine the flour mixture thoroughly with the liquids.
[43] Scrape the sides of the bowl with a spatula while combining until the batter is well combined.
[44] Step 3: Filling.
[45] Mix together cream cheese, sugar, egg yolk, and vanilla until well combined to make the filling.
[46] Step 4: Assemble.
[47] Grease the muffin tins or line the tins with paper cups.
[48] Drop spoonfuls of the pumpkin mixture into the muffin tins.
[49] Add smaller spoonfuls of the cream cheese mixture on top of the pumpkin mixture in each muffin cup.
[50] Swirl the cream cheese and pumpkin mixtures together with a skewer.
[51] Top muffins optionally with crushed nuts.
[52] Top muffins optionally with pumpkin seeds (pepitas).
[53] Step 5: Bake.
[54] Bake the muffins and turn the tins halfway through the baking time.
[55] Bake mini muffins for 20 to 25 minutes.
[56] Bake standard muffins for 25 to 30 minutes.
[57] Bake jumbo muffins for 30 to 40 minutes.
[58] A rhetorical question asks if the recipe process was easy.
[59] Enjoy the muffins.

### GOAL
For each piece, assign exactly one segment label from the provided labels.
If no segment label clearly apply, assign the empty string "".

### MATCHING RULES
- Choose only from the provided segment labels; output the segment label exactly as given.
- If multiple segment labels seem plausible, pick the single best segment label that is most specific to the information piece's content.
- Do not use external knowledge. Ground decisions strictly in the provided transcript.

### OUTPUT
Return a list of labeled pieces. Each piece should have the following fields:
- piece_id: id of the piece
- label_id: id of the segment label or ""
- label: segment label or ""

### NOTES
- Preserve the original order of pieces.
- Do not drop or merge pieces.

	- Context 2: [462 - 465] It starts with 1/4 cup of cold cubed butter.

- Pieces of information (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[p12] ..."):
[1] On crisp fall mornings, warm your belly with a breakfast that celebrates one of the most popular flavors of fall: pumpkin spice latte muffins.
[2] It takes about 30 minutes to make streusel-topped pumpkin spice latte muffins from start to finish.
[3] Things you'll need are listed next.
[4] 1/2 cup rolled oats (not instant).
[5] 1/2 cup flour.
[6] 1/2 cup packed brown sugar.
[7] 1/2 cup roasted pumpkin seeds.
[8] 1/4 cup softened butter.
[9] 2 2/3 cups all-purpose flour.
[10] 3 tablespoons espresso powder.
[11] 2 teaspoons baking soda.
[12] 1 teaspoon salt.
[13] One 15-ounce can of pumpkin pie filling.
[14] 1/4 cup sugar.
[15] 1 cup packed brown sugar.
[16] 1 cup vegetable oil.
[17] 4 large eggs.
[18] 1 cup white chocolate chips.
[19] Cupcake liners.
[20] Muffin pan.
[21] Step 1: Make the streusel topping.
[22] Preheat the oven to 350°F.
[23] Place paper liners in a muffin pan.
[24] Set the muffin pan with liners aside.
[25] In a small bowl, combine rolled oats, 1/2 cup flour, 1/2 cup packed brown sugar, roasted pumpkin seeds, and softened butter.
[26] Combine the streusel ingredients thoroughly.
[27] Set the combined streusel aside to use later as the streusel topping.
[28] Step 2: Mix the flour base for the muffins.
[29] Sift together 2 2/3 cups of flour, 3 tablespoons of espresso powder, 2 teaspoons of baking soda, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
[30] Step 3: Make the pumpkin mixture.
[31] Combine pumpkin pie filling, 1/4 cup sugar, 1 cup packed brown sugar, and 1 cup vegetable oil.
[32] Lightly beat 4 large eggs.
[33] Add the lightly beaten eggs to the pumpkin mixture.
[34] Mix the pumpkin mixture well after adding the eggs.
[35] Step 4: Combine the wet ingredients with the flour base.
[36] Make a small well in the sifted dry ingredients.
[37] Add the wet pumpkin mixture into the well in the dry ingredients.
[38] Stir the combined wet and dry ingredients until the batter is moistened.
[39] Step 5: Add the chocolate chips.
[40] Add 1 cup of white chocolate chips to the batter.
[41] Stir the white chocolate chips into the batter until thoroughly combined.
[42] Step 6: Fill the liners and top with streusel.
[43] Spoon batter into the prepared muffin tin liners, filling each liner about two-thirds full.
[44] Top each filled muffin liner with the prepared streusel.
[45] Step 7: Bake the muffins.
[46] Bake the muffins for 18 to 20 minutes.
[47] Serve the muffins warm.

- Pieces of information (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[p12] ..."):
[1] Classic blueberry muffins are nearly impossible to beat.
[2] These muffins are sweet, fluffy and studded with tangy blueberries.
[3] Blueberry muffins are a favorite for breakfast, brunch or a snack.
[4] This is an easy blueberry muffin recipe suitable as a comforting treat.
[5] The recipe can be adapted to be gluten-free, refined sugar-free or dairy-free.
[6] Things You'll Need
[7] 3 cups all-purpose flour.
[8] 1 cup light brown sugar, packed.
[9] 1 tablespoon baking powder.
[10] 1/2 teaspoon sea salt.
[11] 2 eggs, lightly beaten.
[12] 1 cup buttermilk.
[13] 1/2 cup canola oil.
[14] 1 2/3 cups fresh or frozen blueberries.
[15] Preparation
[16] Heat the oven to 375 F.
[17] Coat a muffin tray with nonstick spray.
[18] Line a muffin tray with baking cups as an alternative to nonstick spray.
[19] Mix the flour, brown sugar, baking powder and salt in a mixing bowl.
[20] Combine the eggs, buttermilk and canola oil in a separate mixing bowl.
[21] Combine wet and dry ingredients in separate bowls.
[22] Stir together the dry ingredients until well combined.
[23] Whisk together the wet ingredients until combined.
[24] Stir together the ingredients.
[25] Pour the wet ingredients into the bowl with the dry ingredients.
[26] Stir the wet and dry ingredients until just combined.
[27] Combine wet and dry ingredients.
[28] Add the blueberries to the batter.
[29] Gently fold the blueberries into the batter using a rubber spatula until just combined.
[30] Fold blueberries into muffin batter.
[31] Scoop blueberry muffin batter into the prepared muffin tray.
[32] Fill each muffin hole 3/4 of the way up when scooping batter.
[33] Scoop batter into muffin tray.
[34] Bake the muffins on the center rack for 30 to 35 minutes.
[35] Test the muffins by poking the center and ensure they test clean before removing from the oven.
[36] Bake muffins in a preheated oven.
[37] Allow the muffins to cool at least 10 minutes before serving.
[38] Serve the muffins warm with butter and honey.
[39] Allow muffins to cool before eating.
[40] Tip
[41] To make the muffins gluten-free, replace regular all-purpose flour with gluten-free all-purpose flour.
[42] To make the muffins dairy-free, replace the buttermilk with unsweetened almond milk.
[43] To avoid refined sugar, replace the brown sugar with coconut sugar.
[44] Use coconut oil or grapeseed oil instead of canola oil as alternatives.
[45] Bake times may differ for those who live at high elevation.

[4] Greener bananas have a better flavor.
[5] Decide how many bananas to buy based on how many will be eaten in the next few days.
[6] Consider whether one banana per day per person is appropriate when deciding how many to buy.
[7] Consider whether bananas will be used in cereal or other dishes when deciding how many to buy.
[8] The ripeness (how green the bananas are) is the most important factor in deciding whether to buy them.
[9] Sometimes buy some bananas that will be perfect in a couple of days and some that are perfect right now.
[10] Sometimes one or two bananas go uneaten or ripen faster than expected.
[11] Banana bread (and similar banana baked goods) was likely created to use bananas that are blackening before they go to waste.
[12] The muffins have a crumbly coating on top.
[13] The crumbly topping adds texture and flavor to the muffins.
[14] The added texture and flavor from the crumble is worth the extra calories.
[15] The presenter does not make these muffins often.
[16] The presenter does not worry much about how unhealthy the muffins might be.
[17] If concerned about calories, using the gym is an option.
[18] Step 1 is the list of ingredients.
[19] Ingredients for the bread are listed separately from the topping and optional items.
[20] Use 3 to 4 bananas, mashed, for the bread.
[21] Use 2 cups of all-purpose flour for the bread.
[22] Use 3/4 cup white sugar for the bread.
[23] Use 1/4 cup brown sugar for the bread.
[24] Use 1 stick of butter, softened, for the bread.
[25] Use 2 eggs, slightly beaten, for the bread.
[26] Use 1 teaspoon of vanilla for the bread.
[27] Use 1 teaspoon of baking soda for the bread.
[28] Use 1/2 teaspoon of salt for the bread.
[29] For the topping use 2 tablespoons of olive oil.
[30] For the topping use 1/3 cup brown sugar.
[31] For the topping use 1 tablespoon of cinnamon.
[32] Optional: use 1 cup of chopped walnuts.
[33] Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit once all ingredients are gathered.
[34] Step 2 is to prepare the bananas.
[35] Peel the bananas and place them in a large bowl.
[36] Bananas with a few spots are acceptable for this recipe.
[37] Cut away any very black parts of bananas if those parts are unappealing.
[38] Peel off any clingy banana strings.
[39] Using a sturdy utensil, thoroughly smash the bananas until mostly liquified.
[40] Be careful when smashing bananas because a utensil could break from excessive force.
[41] Smashing bananas can serve as a stress reliever or an arm workout.
[42] Stop smashing when the bananas are mostly liquified but still have a few bits for texture.
[43] Step 3 is a sweet start where butter and sugars are combined.
[44] Ensure the butter is softened but not melted before combining with sugar.
[45] Combine the softened butter with 3/4 cup white sugar and 1/4 cup brown sugar.
[46] Use a fork or a strong whisk to blend the butter and sugars.
[47] Mix the butter and sugars until the mixture is well blended and creamy.
[48] Step 4 is to mix the wet ingredients with the mashed bananas.
[49] Beat the eggs and add them to the vanilla and the butter/sugar mixture.
[50] Combine the beaten eggs, vanilla, and butter/sugar mixture into the mashed bananas.
[51] If adding walnuts, add them when combining the wet ingredients into the bananas.
[52] Step 5 is to add dry ingredients and finish the batter.
[53] Add the flour, baking soda, and salt to the banana/egg mixture.
[54] Mix the flour, baking soda, and salt into the batter until the dry ingredients are totally incorporated.
[55] Pour the finished batter into the chosen cooking pan.
[56] This recipe can be made as muffins, a loaf, or a cake.
[57] Step 6 is to prepare the topping.
[58] Blend the olive oil, brown sugar, and cinnamon until the mixture becomes very crumbly.
[59] Sprinkle the crumbly topping over the batter.
[60] It is acceptable to make extra topping and apply it thickly.
[61] Typically, butter is used to make a streusel topping.
[62] The recipe uses oil for the topping because there is already a stick of butter in the batter and the presenter is trying to reduce butter intake.
[63] If preferred, replace the oil with 1 to 2 tablespoons of butter for the topping.
[64] Step 7 is to bake the muffins or chosen pan of batter.
[65] Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit if not already preheated.
[66] Bake the batter for a time appropriate to the chosen pan.
[67] Bake muffins for 18 to 20 minutes.
[68] Test muffins with a clean knife or toothpick to ensure they are done.
[69] Let the baked goods cool on a rack for 15 minutes or until they can be safely touched.
[70] After cooling for 15 minutes, proceed with serving or storing the muffins as desired.

If no segment label clearly apply, assign the empty string "".

### MATCHING RULES
- Choose only from the provided segment labels; output the segment label exactly as given.
- If multiple segment labels seem plausible, pick the single best segment label that is most specific to the information piece's content.
- Do not use external knowledge. Ground decisions strictly in the provided transcript.

- piece_id: id of the piece
- label_id: id of the segment label or ""
- label: segment label or ""

- Preserve the original order of pieces.
- Do not drop or merge pieces.

You are a helpful assistant who can understand and analyze tutorial videos.
ROLE: user

You are performing temporal segmentation of a tutorial video for Making Muffins based on Property types (i.e., Label declarative statements that assert a property of an ingredient by which kind of attribute they claim: texture, flavor, or ripeness/visual state.).

### INPUTS
- Canonical segment labels (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[S1] ..."):
[S1] Texture
Definition: Claims about an ingredient's or finished item's physical feel, mouthfeel, firmness/softness, or form that affects texture.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: softened salted butter
	- Context 1: [42 - 48] The batter starts with 1 cup of softened salted butter, and 1 cup of granulated sugar.
	- Content 2: thick but also spreadable
	- Context 2: [150 - 153] Your batter should be thick but also spreadable.
```
[S2] Flavor
Definition: Claims about taste, seasoning, or flavor qualities of an ingredient or the final product.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
	- Context 1: [210 - 221] I've already creamed together the sugar and butter and added in the eggs, so now I'm going to add in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1 teaspoon of lemon extract...
	- Content 2: a nice little crunchy sweet top
	- Context 2: [248 - 255] One fun topping you can experiment with is sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top of your muffins. [255 - 257] This gives it a nice little crunchy sweet top.
```
[S3] Ripeness
Definition: Statements about color, visual state, or degree of maturation or ingredient state (e.g., fresh, frozen, green, ripe, overripe).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: fresh blueberries
	- Context 1: [221 - 232] Continue on with the rest of the recipe, adding in the flour and buttermilk, once you have your batter finished, you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries, or frozen even, you can use those too.
	- Content 2: frozen even
	- Context 2: [221 - 232] Continue on with the rest of the recipe, adding in the flour and buttermilk, once you have your batter finished, you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries, or frozen even, you can use those too.
```
[S4] Temperature
Definition: Statements about the temperature or thermal state of an ingredient or finished item (e.g., room temperature, chilled, warm, oven temperature, storage temperature).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit
	- Context 1: [14 - 18] Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
	- Content 2: cold cubed butter
	- Context 2: [462 - 465] It starts with 1/4 cup of cold cubed butter.
```
- Pieces of information (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[p12] ..."):
[1] This is a one-bowl oatmeal protein muffin recipe.
[2] The recipe is low in sugar.
[3] The recipe is flexible with substitutions.
[4] The recipe includes three simple sources of protein: nut butter, chia seeds, and flaxseed.
[5] These muffins are seriously delicious.
[6] Image shows oatmeal protein muffins with chocolate chips and banana chips.
[7] List of things you'll need for the recipe follows.
[8] Use 3 very ripe bananas or 1 cup of applesauce.
[9] Use 1 cup of milk, which can be dairy, coconut, or almond.
[10] Use 1/2 cup peanut butter or any nut butter.
[11] Use 2 eggs.
[12] Use 1/4 cup maple syrup or honey.
[13] Use 1 teaspoon vanilla.
[14] Use 1 tablespoon baking powder.
[15] Use 1/4 cup ground flaxseed.
[16] Use 1 tablespoon chia seeds.
[17] Use 3 cups whole oats.
[18] Optional toppings include chocolate chips and dried banana chips.
[19] Tip: The peanut butter-banana base can be adapted to suit many different tastes.
[20] Applesauce works in place of bananas.
[21] Any nut butter can be used instead of peanut butter.
[22] Image shows ingredients for oatmeal protein muffins.
[23] Get started by preheating the oven to 375 degrees F.
[24] Grease the muffin pan.
[25] Use coconut oil, spray, or butter to grease the pan.
[26] Mash the bananas in a large mixing bowl.
[27] Image caption: The browner the bananas, the better for baking because they have more flavor.
[28] A potato masher works best for very ripe bananas.
[29] A fork can be used to mash very ripe bananas if a potato masher is not available.
[30] Add the remaining ingredients to the mashed bananas.
[31] Combine all ingredients and stir until thoroughly mixed.
[32] Image caption: Use regular milk, almond milk, or coconut milk.
[33] Image caption: There is no need to beat the eggs ahead of time; just crack and mix them.
[34] Image caption: Maple syrup was used here but honey is also delicious.
[35] Make the recipe gluten-free by using specially marked containers of whole oats.
[36] There is no worry of over-mixing because this recipe does not use flour.
[37] Prepare to bake by filling muffin cups to the top.
[38] Use a 3-ounce ice cream scoop to evenly distribute muffin batter into pans.
[39] Add optional toppings such as chocolate chips or banana chips at the time of filling the cups.
[40] Tip: Place a couple of chocolate or banana chips in the bottom of each cup before ladling in the batter.
[41] Tip: Try using coconut oil spray to grease the pan.
[42] Bake the muffins at 375 degrees F for 25 minutes.
[43] After baking, cool the muffins on a rack.
[44] Image shows oatmeal protein muffins with banana chips on top.
[45] Store baked muffins refrigerated in an airtight container for 3 to 5 days.
[46] Freeze muffins in a single layer inside a zip-top freezer bag for longer storage.
[47] Image caption: Mix and match your toppings, or add more.

- Pieces of information (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[p12] ..."):
[1] Homemade muffins are a special addition to breakfast or brunch.
[2] Enjoy muffins with friends and family.
[3] Make muffins as a grab-and-go breakfast for busy work weeks.
[4] Morning Glory muffins are warmly spiced with cinnamon.
[5] Morning Glory muffins are made with grated carrot, grated apple, raisins, chopped walnuts, shredded coconut, and sometimes pineapple.
[6] While the ingredient list for Morning Glory muffins is long, the baking process is simple.
[7] This recipe makes 12 muffins.
[8] Things you'll need are listed next.
[9] 1-1/4 cups all-purpose flour is required.
[10] 1 cup shredded coconut is required.
[11] 3/4 cup light brown sugar, tightly packed, is required.
[12] 1-1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon is required.
[13] 1/2 teaspoon sea salt is required.
[14] 1 teaspoon baking powder is required.
[15] 1 cup grated carrot, about 1 large carrot peeled and grated, is required.
[16] 1 cup grated apple, about half a large apple such as Honeycrisp, is required.
[17] 1/2 cup raisins is required.
[18] 1/2 cup raw walnuts, chopped, is required.
[19] 2 large eggs are required.
[20] 1/4 cup olive oil or canola oil is required.
[21] 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract is required.
[22] A box grater is required.
[23] Two mixing bowls are required.
[24] A spoon or fork for mixing is required.
[25] Twelve disposable baking cups are required.
[26] A 12-hole muffin tray is required.
[27] Tip header introduces time-saving and substitution suggestions.
[28] To save time, use a food processor to shred the carrot and apple.
[29] Replace all-purpose flour with gluten-free all-purpose flour to make the muffins gluten-free.
[30] Replace brown sugar with coconut sugar to make naturally sweetened, refined sugar-free muffins.
[31] You can choose to use sweetened or unsweetened shredded coconut.
[32] Instructions for making the muffins follow.
[33] Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
[34] Grate 1 cup-worth of carrot.
[35] Grate 1 cup-worth of apple.
[36] Add the flour to a mixing bowl.
[37] Add the ground cinnamon to the mixing bowl.
[38] Add the brown sugar to the mixing bowl.
[39] Add the baking powder to the mixing bowl.
[40] Add the salt to the mixing bowl.
[41] Stir the flour, cinnamon, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt together in the mixing bowl.
[42] Add the grated carrot to the flour mixture.
[43] Add the grated apple to the flour mixture.
[44] Add the raisins to the flour mixture.
[45] Add the chopped walnuts to the flour mixture.
[46] Stir the grated carrot, grated apple, raisins, and chopped walnuts into the flour mixture to combine.
[47] In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, oil, and vanilla extract.
[48] Add the egg, oil, and vanilla mixture to the bowl with the flour mixture.
[49] Stir the combined wet and dry mixtures well until a thick batter forms.
[50] Line a 12-hole muffin pan with baking cups.
[51] Scoop batter into the lined muffin pan using an ice cream scoop or small measuring cup.
[52] Fill each muffin hole two-thirds of the way up with batter.
[53] Bake the muffins on the center rack of the preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes.
[54] Bake until muffins test clean when poked with a toothpick.
[55] Allow the muffins to cool for 10 minutes before serving.
[56] Enjoy the muffins.

If no segment label clearly apply, assign the empty string "".

### MATCHING RULES
- Choose only from the provided segment labels; output the segment label exactly as given.
- If multiple segment labels seem plausible, pick the single best segment label that is most specific to the information piece's content.

### OUTPUT

You are a helpful assistant who can understand and analyze tutorial videos.
ROLE: user

You are performing temporal segmentation of a tutorial video for Making Muffins based on Property types (i.e., Label declarative statements that assert a property of an ingredient by which kind of attribute they claim: texture, flavor, or ripeness/visual state.).

### INPUTS
- Canonical segment labels (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[S1] ..."):
[S1] Texture
Definition: Claims about an ingredient's or finished item's physical feel, mouthfeel, firmness/softness, or form that affects texture.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: softened salted butter
	- Context 1: [42 - 48] The batter starts with 1 cup of softened salted butter, and 1 cup of granulated sugar.
	- Content 2: thick but also spreadable
	- Context 2: [150 - 153] Your batter should be thick but also spreadable.
```
[S2] Flavor
Definition: Claims about taste, seasoning, or flavor qualities of an ingredient or the final product.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
	- Context 1: [210 - 221] I've already creamed together the sugar and butter and added in the eggs, so now I'm going to add in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1 teaspoon of lemon extract...
	- Content 2: a nice little crunchy sweet top
	- Context 2: [248 - 255] One fun topping you can experiment with is sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top of your muffins. [255 - 257] This gives it a nice little crunchy sweet top.
```
[S3] Ripeness
Definition: Statements about color, visual state, or degree of maturation or ingredient state (e.g., fresh, frozen, green, ripe, overripe).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: fresh blueberries
	- Context 1: [221 - 232] Continue on with the rest of the recipe, adding in the flour and buttermilk, once you have your batter finished, you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries, or frozen even, you can use those too.
	- Content 2: frozen even
	- Context 2: [221 - 232] Continue on with the rest of the recipe, adding in the flour and buttermilk, once you have your batter finished, you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries, or frozen even, you can use those too.
```
[S4] Temperature
Definition: Statements about the temperature or thermal state of an ingredient or finished item (e.g., room temperature, chilled, warm, oven temperature, storage temperature).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit
	- Context 1: [14 - 18] Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
	- Content 2: cold cubed butter
	- Context 2: [462 - 465] It starts with 1/4 cup of cold cubed butter.
```
- Pieces of information (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[p12] ..."):
[1] These are my blueberry muffins.
[2] Mmm, my favorite muffin.
[3] Add grated lemon zest to a large mixing bowl.
[4] Add a milk of choice to a large mixing bowl.
[5] The instructor is using soy milk.
[6] Add sugar to a large mixing bowl.
[7] Add a neutral vegetable oil to a large mixing bowl.
[8] Add vanilla extract to a large mixing bowl.
[9] Whisk the ingredients well until they are well combined.
[10] Sift flour into the bowl along with baking powder.
[11] Add a pinch of salt while sifting the flour.
[12] Adding flour with baking powder and salt makes muffins soft and fluffy.
[13] Whisk wet and dry ingredients for a short minute until lumps are gone.
[14] Do not overmix the batter.
[15] Rinse the blueberries.
[16] Shake the water off the blueberries.
[17] Add the blueberries to a bowl after rinsing and shaking off the water.
[18] Toss the blueberries with cornstarch.
[19] Add the cornstarch-coated blueberries to the batter.
[20] Stir the blueberries in the mixture gently.
[21] Fold the blueberries into the mixture gently.
[22] Transfer the batter to the muffin liners.
[23] This recipe yields about 12 muffins.
[24] Fill the muffin liners almost to the top.
[25] Optionally sprinkle sugar on top of the muffins.
[26] Do not sprinkle sugar because the muffins are intended for breakfast.
[27] Bake the muffins in a preheated oven for 22 and a half minutes.
[28] Bake the muffins until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out dry.
[29] Let the muffins cool down for about 30 minutes.
[30] Easy, right?

- Do not use external knowledge. Ground decisions strictly in the provided transcript.

[2] I'm going to show you how to make moist, fluffy chocolate chip muffins with a bakery-style top and crisp edge.
[3] This is Preppy Kitchen and John Kanell teaches how to make delicious homemade dishes to share with family and friends.
[4] These chocolate chip muffins whip up quickly.
[5] Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
[6] A high blast of heat when the muffins go in sets the edge and lets the muffins rise up to form a bakery-style dome.
[7] Baking at 350 degrees Fahrenheit causes the muffins to spread out and not form the desired bakery-style muffin.
[8] Prepare the dry ingredients.
[9] Use a scale for the most accurate results when measuring ingredients.
[10] If you are using cups instead of a scale, watch the 'how to measure flour' video for proper measuring technique.
[11] The 'how to measure flour' video shows all the ins and outs of measuring flour correctly.
[12] Measuring flour incorrectly is the thing that goes wrong most often in baking.
[13] Adding too much flour to a recipe negatively affects baking results.
[14] Place a sifter and a bowl on the work surface for dry ingredients.
[15] Add 2 and 3/14 cups (330 grams) of all-purpose flour into the bowl.
[16] Add one teaspoon of salt to the dry ingredients.
[17] Use one teaspoon of salt to provide contrast to the chocolate and sugar and to amp the flavor.
[18] Add one tablespoon of baking powder for leavening.
[19] Using a relatively large amount of baking powder helps produce a bakery-style top.
[20] Sift the dry ingredients.
[21] Set the scale aside after measuring.
[22] Give the sifted dry ingredients a quick whisk.
[23] Set the whisked dry ingredients aside.
[24] Melted butter was prepared a minute earlier.
[25] The melted butter has cooled down.
[26] Warm the cooled butter in the microwave if needed.
[27] Keep wet ingredients at room temperature for best results.
[28] If wet ingredients get cold, warm them in the microwave.
[29] The counter is very cold and will cool ingredients down.
[30] Measure 300 ml (1 1/4 cups) of whole milk.
[31] Add the measured whole milk to the wet ingredients bowl.
[32] Add half a cup (113 grams) of unsalted butter that has been melted.
[33] Scrape all melted butter into the wet ingredients bowl.
[34] Introduce Brian as a first-time filmer for Preppy Kitchen today.
[35] Brian is present behind the camera and is eating cookies made by the host.
[36] Add one cup (200 grams) of sugar to the wet ingredients bowl.
[37] Give the wet ingredients a little whisk to combine them.
[38] If clumps of butter appear when mixing wet ingredients, microwave the mixture for 40 seconds to fix it.
[39] Using warm milk helps prevent butter clumps when mixing wet ingredients.
[40] Add two large eggs to the wet ingredient bowl.
[41] Add 1 1/4 cups of sour cream to the wet ingredient bowl.
[42] If sour cream is unavailable, use full-fat plain yogurt instead.
[43] Add one tablespoon (15 ml) of vanilla extract (optional).
[44] Whisk the wet ingredients together.
[45] The wet mixture can turn into a butter mush if the ingredients are not properly combined.
[46] If the wet mixture becomes a butter mush, apply a little heat in the microwave after whisking the eggs in.
[47] Do not microwave the wet mixture before whisking the eggs because the eggs could be overcooked.
[48] A small amount of heat will remedy issues with the wet mixture consistency.
[49] Warm the wet mixture briefly and then whisk it again.
[50] Aim for a nice, homogenous, fluid wet mixture.
[51] Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.
[52] Whisk the combined wet and dry ingredients to almost combined.
[53] Having a few clumps of flour in the batter is acceptable because further mixing will occur after adding chocolate chips.
[54] It is fine to have a couple clumps of flour in the batter at this stage.
[55] Prepare chocolate for the batter.
[56] The recipe specifies 1 1/2 cups of semisweet chocolate chips.
[57] The instructor is using one cup semisweet and half a cup bittersweet chocolate for a richer mix.
[58] You can use milk chocolate if you prefer.
[59] Reserve a handful of semisweet chocolate chips to sprinkle on top of the muffins for appearance.
[60] Add the rest of the chocolate chips to the batter.
[61] Fold the chocolate chips into the batter with a spatula rather than using a whisk.
[62] After folding in the chocolate chips, transfer the batter into the muffin tins.
[63] Demonstrate two methods of baking: naked muffins (no paper liners) and muffins in paper liners.
[64] Expect differences in appearance between muffins baked naked and muffins baked in paper liners.
[65] Butter and flour half of the muffin tins as a release method.
[66] Coat butter across the muffin cavity, add a good dash of flour, move the flour around, and dump out the excess flour.
[67] Use paper muffin liners for the rest of the tin cavities to produce taller muffins but with less crisp edge.
[68] Paper liners go a bit higher and prevent the mushroom-shaped muffin top while still allowing a nice dome.
[69] Transfer batter into the muffin tin.
[70] If you prefer a nice crispy muffin edge, bake without paper liners.
[71] When baking without paper liners, be careful to add enough butter and flour so muffins pop out easily.
[72] Use a large ice cream scooper to transfer batter into the muffin tin.
[73] Fill the muffin cavities all the way to the top for big bakery-style muffins.
[74] Normally cupcake batter fills two-thirds of the way, but for these muffins the cups should be filled full.
[75] When filling paper liners, avoid getting batter on the edges to prevent burning.
[76] Batter on the edges will burn and mainly affects appearance rather than bake quality.
[77] Monitor chocolate chip distribution while scooping the batter to ensure even chip distribution.
[78] If a scoop lacks chocolate chips, add some chips to that scoop to balance distribution.
[79] After filling muffin cavities, top the muffins with a scattering of reserved chocolate chips.
[80] Adding chocolate chips on top gives glossy, melty chocolate tops and significantly improves appearance.
[81] Chocolate chip muffins look naked without chocolate chips on top.
[82] This recipe yields exactly 12 large muffins.
[83] High initial oven heat locks in the muffin edge so the top can burst through and form a bakery-style dome.
[84] Bake the muffins at 425°F for five minutes, then reduce the oven temperature to 350°F and bake for 20 to 25 minutes.
[85] Bake until the top is nicely golden and the center is set.
[86] Insert a skewer into the center of a muffin to check doneness; it should come out clean except for molten chocolate.
[87] Place the muffin tin into the oven.
[88] Remove the muffins from the oven and cool them just enough to touch before handling.
[89] Muffins baked without paper liners have a crisp edge, a little muffin overhang, and a golden brown color.
[90] Muffins baked in paper liners are guided upward by the paper, are a bit taller, and lack the crisp edge.
[91] Muffins baked in paper liners feel soft all over.
[92] Inspect the inside of a muffin to evaluate crumb and chocolate distribution.
[93] If you like the video, check out the host's chocolate playlist.
[94] There is someone making funny faces behind the camera.
[95] The chocolate playlist contains the host's favorite chocolate recipes which are very delicious.
[96] Now taste a muffin.
[97] The muffin tastes exceptionally good and perfect.
[98] If you like the videos, hit the like button and subscribe.
[99] The host will see viewers in the next video.

MESSAGES: ROLE: system

You are a helpful assistant who can understand and analyze tutorial videos.
ROLE: user

You are performing temporal segmentation of a tutorial video for Making Muffins based on Property types (i.e., Label declarative statements that assert a property of an ingredient by which kind of attribute they claim: texture, flavor, or ripeness/visual state.).

### INPUTS
- Canonical segment labels (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[S1] ..."):
[S1] Texture
Definition: Claims about an ingredient's or finished item's physical feel, mouthfeel, firmness/softness, or form that affects texture.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: softened salted butter
	- Context 1: [42 - 48] The batter starts with 1 cup of softened salted butter, and 1 cup of granulated sugar.
	- Content 2: thick but also spreadable
	- Context 2: [150 - 153] Your batter should be thick but also spreadable.
```
[S2] Flavor
Definition: Claims about taste, seasoning, or flavor qualities of an ingredient or the final product.
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
	- Context 1: [210 - 221] I've already creamed together the sugar and butter and added in the eggs, so now I'm going to add in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1 teaspoon of lemon extract...
	- Content 2: a nice little crunchy sweet top
	- Context 2: [248 - 255] One fun topping you can experiment with is sprinkling on about 1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top of your muffins. [255 - 257] This gives it a nice little crunchy sweet top.
```
[S3] Ripeness
Definition: Statements about color, visual state, or degree of maturation or ingredient state (e.g., fresh, frozen, green, ripe, overripe).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: fresh blueberries
	- Context 1: [221 - 232] Continue on with the rest of the recipe, adding in the flour and buttermilk, once you have your batter finished, you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries, or frozen even, you can use those too.
	- Content 2: frozen even
	- Context 2: [221 - 232] Continue on with the rest of the recipe, adding in the flour and buttermilk, once you have your batter finished, you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries, or frozen even, you can use those too.
```
[S4] Temperature
Definition: Statements about the temperature or thermal state of an ingredient or finished item (e.g., room temperature, chilled, warm, oven temperature, storage temperature).
Examples (Contents and Context): ```
	- Content 1: preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit
	- Context 1: [14 - 18] Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
	- Content 2: cold cubed butter
	- Context 2: [462 - 465] It starts with 1/4 cup of cold cubed butter.
```
- Pieces of information (each starts with an ID in square brackets, e.g., "[p12] ..."):
[1] Hey guys, I'm Dina from simplyhomecooked.com.
[2] Today I'll be showing you how to make fluffy and moist blueberry muffins.
[3] The muffins are loaded with a ton of blueberries.
[4] The muffins are topped with a simple and delicious brown sugar streusel.
[5] Start by combining all dry ingredients.
[6] In a large bowl, combine two cups of all-purpose flour.
[7] In a large bowl, add one teaspoon of baking powder.
[8] In a large bowl, add half a teaspoon of baking soda.
[9] In a large bowl, add a quarter teaspoon of salt.
[10] Whisk the dry ingredients together.
[11] Reserve one tablespoon of the flour mixture.
[12] Mix the reserved tablespoon of the flour mixture with one and a half cups of fresh blueberries.
[13] The reason for adding a small amount of flour to the blueberries is related to when the blueberries are added to the batter.
[14] Coating blueberries in flour prevents the blueberries from sinking as fast during baking.
[15] Add three eggs into a large bowl.
[16] Whisk the three eggs on high speed using an electric mixer.
[17] Whisk the eggs for about three minutes until the eggs become fluffy and pale.
[18] Continue beating the eggs as you slowly add one cup of granulated sugar.
[19] Keep beating the eggs for about three more minutes after adding the sugar.
[20] Well-beaten eggs are the key to really fluffy muffins.
[21] Add one teaspoon of vanilla extract.
[22] Add one tablespoon of fresh lemon juice.
[23] Continue beating the egg mixture as you slowly add three quarters of a cup of heavy cream.
[24] Begin adding the dry ingredients to the wet mixture rather than adding all at once.
[25] Do not add all of the dry ingredients to the batter at once.
[26] Get a sifter.
[27] Add about a third of the flour mixture at a time to the batter.
[28] Mix between each addition of the flour mixture.
[29] Once all of the dry ingredients are well combined into the muffin batter, the batter is ready for the next step.
[30] Continue beating the batter with an electric mixer while preparing to add butter.
[31] Slowly and gradually add four tablespoons of melted unsalted butter to the batter.
[32] The last step before portioning is adding the blueberries.
[33] Fold the blueberries into the batter with a spatula.
[34] Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners.
[35] Begin scooping the batter into the lined muffin tin using a large cookie scoop.
[36] Top each muffin with a few extra blueberries if desired.
[37] Topping muffins with extra blueberries is optional.
[38] Before baking, make a simple streusel topping.
[39] In a small bowl, combine one tablespoon of unsalted cold cubed butter, two tablespoons of all-purpose flour, a pinch of salt, one teaspoon of cinnamon, and three tablespoons of brown sugar.
[40] Mash the streusel ingredients together using a fork until the ingredients are well combined.
[41] Mash the streusel ingredients until they have a crumbly texture.
[42] Top the blueberry muffins with the streusel topping.
[43] Bake the topped muffins in the oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for about 35 minutes.
[44] I hope you enjoyed watching this video; please share, like, and subscribe to the channel.
[45] See you next time!
